title: Is the current state of the game depressing for anyone else?
body: I'm not emotionally invested in the game or anything like that. I don't know. I guess it's sad to see a game die because of its own creators rather than third parties. It's like a son getting killed by his father instead of by a wild animal. It's a massive waste and there's no one to blame but Riot.

replies.body: Yea i really feel that way. It's really sad to see all this spiraling out of control like this. Its like "Should i stick with it? Do i jump ship? Is this going to get better? Is it really even that bad?" that you have to keep asking yourself. But when a game is at a point where it makes you have to ask such questions its already in a terrible state.

I really don't understand all the complaining about how the game has changed, the most significant change is dynamic queue which yeah has it's downsides but is essentially better.  Most of the time I don't get grouped with premades or against them unless I am part of one.  It's only really bad when compared to solo q at super high rankings, which 98% of the playerbase is not.  Overall I'm fine with this season, yeah it's a little harder to climb ranked but seriously so many people take things way out of proportion and are complaining to complain.

With solo and ranked 5's there's really no need for dynamic, which is what Riot wants to keep because they believe it builds a more team oriented experience.  It's hard to know what your ranked standing truly is unless there is only one ranking system.  Dynamic queue ranking incorporates solo play and also group play.  A lot of players wanted to play ranked with friends but that was impossible unless you had only 1 friend or exactly 4 friends to play with.  Ranked 5s rankings were pretty shit in my experience because teams would be so imbalanced 90% of the time, since your solo ranking didn't matter for that.  Riot is trying to make things in ranked better, going back to the old system just undoes any sort of improvement they've made this past year and putting all 3 queues together would make the ranking system very confusing because most of the time dynamic is pretty similar to old solo queue, but now you couldn't rank them the same way.  I admit there needs to be some improvements to the current system, but going back to solo is not the correct way in my opinion.

At very high levels of play that may be the case, but for me and 95% of the playerbase ranked 5's was a shit show and far worse than any form of dynamic queue.  And I agree that at high levels the current system is a shit show, but that's another issue entirely due to the separate issues very high levels of play deal with.  Maybe if they made dynamic only involve groups of 2, 3 or 5 it would be better.  Dealing with a trio and another solo seems a lot better than being the odd man out with a group of 4.

All i have to say is this, if dynamic cannot survive just because solo Queue was put back then the game mode should never have existed in the first place, the fact that riot thinks dyna queue would immediately collapse if solo was added also says that the mode should never have existed.

Heck if i had to choose between going back in time to kill hitler or going back in time to stop lyte from being hired to riot games i would honestly have to think about it.

You'd prefer your favorite video game to be good rather than prevent the deaths of over 6 million humans?

Can we ban this kid from the internet, please?

Well honestly it is not a choice i would never go back in time to kill hitler even if i had the option to do so if only for the fact that we as a world were forced to advance technology at a much faster pace because of it which in turn saved billions of lives, not to mention neither you or i would exist most likely if such a change were made.

but hey go ahead and try to pull the monster card to win your arguments for you.

Man, if I could go back to season 3 my life would be complete.
:( #bringbackseason3
Season 3 was the golden season for me. Sure it probably had its own problems and imbalances, but I have less fun playing with friends in season 6 than I had playing solo in season 3.

I see the DQ complaints here, but that's not the main reason I quit. Since the juggernaut catastrophe, I've had less and less fun playing with every subsequent patch.  When preseason 6 started, I'd actually begun to _hate_ the game instead of just disagreeing with its direction like I normally did when some big unwanted change went through.  With everything that's happened this season...well, my last game was in the middle of April after taking 1-2 week breaks between  handfuls of games and I'm not missing League.  I'm only missing what it used to be and hope that in season 7 Riot will come to their senses instead of accelerating this disaster in the making.

The juggernaut patch was such a mess. It never should have dropped that close to worlds, especially not in the balance state it was in. Should have waited until preseason.

And dragon ghost? that's a mechanic best left on the cutting room floor.
Too much focus on fast paced gameplay and "big" plays for their viewer base of streamed games.  When heals where hit with a nerf stick I gave up on ranked play.

Fastpaced what? Laneswaps bruh. All they did was accelerate snowball, i.e., you didn't need to starve the enemy team for 10+ minutes after you got ahead.

Also, I fricking dare you to show me the patchnotes of any champion that got an over-all increase in damage.

Overtuned as in from hero conception.  Also Zed did technically get a damage boost last patch.  It requires him to use clones more aggresively therefore making him slightly less safe but he did get a dmg boost.
That was a dark fucking comparison, but I kinda agree.
It's ironic, that the game got better when it comes to AFKs and negativity of all kinds, but plummets everywhere else from gameplay balance to matchmaking at the same time.

Honestly I'd rather lose because of imbalance rather than because one of my teammates were AFK/Trolling/Feeders.

At least with balance or matchmaking, theres a slight chance that you can win and the game is actually fun (a bit) for a while. With AFK's and trolls, you know you're fucked and theres nothing you can do about it.
Trading one for the other, is still a lose-lose situation.

The game is majorly depressing and borderline infuriating right now, too much damage, assassins are stupid op, ap got the short end of the stick, and tanks are made of tissue paper come lategame now.

Hell I dont even play this game for fun anymore, I play it because I feel obligated to since Ive sunk so much time into League in the past.

>too much damage

From what exactly? I'll wait.
>assassins are stupid op

Zed, LB and the supernerfed Fizz all sitting around with their acceptable winrates. Never mind all the others, it does ill to speak of the dead.
> ap got the short end of the stick

As evidenced by neither LCS nor soloQ.
>and tanks are made of tissue paper come lategame now.

Since the end of S2, yup. 
> Hell I dont even play this game for fun anymore, I play it because I feel obligated to since Ive sunk so much time into League in the past.

I advice against that, why not play a similar f2p game where your LoL experience helps you?

Too much damage from the fact that if you look even back to season 5 there wasn't nearly as much free damage everywhere, champs had lower bases and scalings for the most part and items weren't nearly as out-of-hand {{item:3147}} 

not to mention free max crit and cdr for all adc's

Ap getting the short end of the stick due to the fact that in the mage item "rework" almost every change was a nerf.
mana regen got all but removed for ap mids, right after they deleted mana pots, AP losses across the board (hell {{item:3157}} used to be a 120 AP/50 Ar item) and spellvamp removal.

Tanks being made of tissue paper is thanks to the large number of armor pen items available now. along with {{item:3036}} punishing tanks for being tanks.

and theres no similar game I enjoy, I've played them all and league does it best, it's just in a bad place right now.

The old offense tree was full of free damage. It had natural talent for ADs and APs but good. LW was 10x better than its current iteration, an insane damage spike against everyone if you had the AD to back it up. 

It shred through tanks far more easily since it also cut through their base armor. Now it punishes HP stacking, wow, shame that FH, IBG and Tabi's exist. Flat armor pen isn't good against tanks due to the large amount of armor they can stack. 300 ar vs 270 ar isn't that big a deal. Not to mention the BorK nerfs.

Max crit was already a thing with Zeke's. CDR comes at the price of a delayed IE, since you also need AS, LS and Ar pen.

You have nothing to back up the statement that every change was a nerf. I have winrates from everywhere. 

Mana regen became more interactive via Lost Chapter, Catalyst and Chalice. 

You never got Hourglass for the AP, it doesn't matter. Not to mention the CDR can increase your damage output and the reduced price allows you to build other AP items quicker. 

Spellvamp was a noobtrap for all things not Vlad, deal with it.

The current offense tree has twice the damage in it than the old masteries just in keystones alone.

Every major assassin and most major adc items have armor penetration, put that with {{item:3036}} and you're ignoring about the same amount of armor that you were in S5, if not more.

Yes max crit was a thing but for that YOUR SUPPORT had to give up an item slot to help you out with it, now max crit is handed to every adc on a silver platter on items that have other good stats as well.

I have plenty to back up my statement that there were nerfs in the MYMU, as I said the Flat removal of mana regen for AP mages (It's not interactive, it's "if you want mana back you have 3 options, face-tank damage, level up, or recall now"), huge nerfs to base damage and scalings, especially for {{champion:63}} but {{champion:161}} also got damage nerfs, save for his ult, {{champion:90}} had a damage nerf on his E, {{champion:8}} had his healing and his damage on his Q nerfed, but got a shiny new 3-hit passive (have I seen those before somewhere?) and {{champion:143}} got damage nerfs on her Q, for a few of the direct nerfs.  

Hourglass used to be among the 120 AP items, which there is currently only one survivor, it was a staple item for any mage back then, the active was icing on the cake.

Spellvamp being a noobtrap was true on some champions but a lot made great use of it, I remember buying Will of the Ancients on {{champion:63}} and being able to heal to full hp off one large minion wave, plus the CDR on it was also good.

You're just ignoring everything I said about armor pen? About flat armor pen being invalidated by armor stacking, about bonus armor pen vs total armor pen? Kek.

Let's see, the old masteries had flat AD/AP, %increase of bonus AD/AP, a mastery that gave you AS every time you crit and 2 forms of %increase in damage. The current masteries have all that but worse or not at all and in exchange, keystones exist, contingent increases in damage.

Again, you can't point me to any mage who's performing worse. All you can do is point at a few number nerfs whilst ignoring the buffs to their damage (over time), range or utility. 

I'll explain, they did a few minor number nerfs so the mages couldn't just instaclear waves with enough AP/levels instead of using their combos correctly. SV was removed for the same reason (and bc of Vlad), so you couldn't just miss everything and vamp back up.

Yes, back when there were 3 120 AP items, Hourglass was bought for the flat AP. Luckily! this changed and we got more flat AP items, so you now need to use the active well in order to get your gold's worth. And it's not like that active can't be stupidly impactful, it was a core item on Nidalee even after it became expensive as all get out.

I talked about the armor pen but I will again
Say you're an assassin with Maw, Yomuu's, and Duskblade, thats 40 flat pen plus 7% from masteries so about 45 flat, 45% bonus penetration, and a ton of extremely useful offensive and defensive stats, 2 passives, and an active. Yeah, armor pen is terrible right now.

Current masteries has free lifesteal, free bonus damage on basic attacks, and an extra DoT on every ability, plus AD and AP, attack speed, extra magic/armor pen... You get the idea, the only thing it doesn't have is the old arcane blade mastery that helped mages cs 

Minor nerfs? Not at all, especially for Brand, His numbers were hit extremely hard, His E now does HALF the damage as before as a quick example and he LOST utility because hIs stun was also nerfed to 1.5 sec instead of 2

Plus AD champions are allowed to miss everything and lifesteal back up, its actually encouraged with Ravenous Hydra, but the same thing isnt fine for mages?

The fact that there used to be 3 120 AP items shows how mages are getting the short end of thr stick as I said, mage items are always being nerfed or removed, while AD items get buffed and have extremely cost effecient stats and usually strong passives and actives, as well as them getting new items that give insane power spikes (Duskblade, The new Rageblade, Yomuu's)

The active on Hourglass doesn't save you 9 out of 10 times thanks to it making you unable to move and lets the enemies surround you while the AD counterpart (Maw) is a passive thats a huge bubble ontop of giving you extra lifesteal when it procs with no player imput.

I never said armor pen was terrible, I said the old LW was better. You were implying tanks are getting blown up (late game) thanks to S6, when reality, it's thanks to S2.

I completely forgot the old offense tree had %hybrid pen, oops. As I said, the current numbers on the ferocity tree are flat out worse than what we had in S5. ADs got free LS but lost hp/5 and flat HP because they can't afford to put points in the tank tree anymore. In exchange everyone got keystones.

Brand got an AoE %hp nuke in exchange for a nerf to an ability he maxes last and is unlikely to hit without prior setup.

They are in indeed, firstly, using AAs puts you at greater risk than casting abilities (creep aggro, no CC or utility, less range). Secondly, ADs tend to be less reliant on their full combo to be useful, while APs can singlehandedly devastate teamfights from range with theirs. Thirdly, APs could buy gunblade if they really wanted LS. It's the same thing, isn't it? ADs need to use their AAs to sustain too.

Oh come on! The new rageblade and devourer are without a doubt worse version of their predecessors. Then we have the fact that melee ADs can't buy IE anymore since G-Blade no longer gives crit.
AP champions have always had the problem that they get utility and CC alongside their damage. Not to mention their waveclear (due to an obligatory AoE ability that outranges most abilities). It's hard to balance that considering they can nuke you with enough items like any other damage threat.

Yep, you need to use Hourglass intelligently i.e. either bait a major cooldown or use your own rotations before activating stasis. Maw is pretty BS even if it fits thematically (encourages DPS), so it's getting nerfed next patch.

In season 5 I could roll a tank and get attacked by an ADC or an assassin and usually last about 5-10 seconds before dying (presuming this is full build) but now I'm lucky to even last 2-3 seconds on someone like Zac while healing from his passive, I can usually get nuked from 100% HP to 0 before all 3 bounces of my ult go off now.

Brand's %hp nuke is from hitting 3 spells in a short time on an enemy, unless you do so the passive got nerfed to 2/4% max hp from 8 over 4 seconds.
And his E is a lock-on ability that gets maxed second, why can't you hit it without prior set-up? Plus Brand's Q, ult, and E damage ALL got nerfed, hard, not just one.

Gunblade is terrible on most AP casters, even if you wanted the omnivamp, the stats are not good for AP
And AD's also now have the ability to heal from all physical damage instead of just auto attacks thanks to Death's Dance, which also has a defensive passive and CDR.

By the way, what AD isn't reliant on their combo, every assassin has to use their full combo, almost every ADC has burst-mage rivaling damage in their abilities, and AD bruisers are also reliant on their abilities for their damage.
Also, Attack ranges for any ADC, except maybe Lucian and Kindred, are just about as far as a lot of mage ability cast ranges, so they can lifesteal from afar, not to mention seeing ADC's and Assassins healing for 300 per auto off crits.

The new Rageblade got the Sated Devourer passive, making on-hit AD fighters insane, like Yi or Jax for example.

A lot of AD champions have utility in their kits, almost every assassin has a movement ability, usually a form of teleport, While other AD Champions have stuns, invulnerabilities, slows, blinds, fears, knock-ups. It isn't exclusive to AP, so should every AD champion with utility have a massive damage nerf? Also every assassin has waveclear and ADC's are almost 100% waveclear and siege, even AD bruisers have easy waveclear.

Even if you use Hourglass intelligently (dodge that jinx ult at the lase second) you're stuck in that spot for a full 2.5 seconds, that gives the enemy plenty of time to line up an ability to hit just as you exit Zhonya's or to catch up to you and kill you when it ends, there's no downside to AD defensive items but a massive downside to the ONLY AP armor item.

{{item:3146}}  is bad? Not to be rude but are you crazy? 80Ap already makes it a pretty decent item for AP champs. 40 AD is kinda crap but hey, it means your autos are actually worth a damn, its something. You get 15% sustain which is pretty huge, since most mage spells are AoE, so that Xerath Q or Lux E or Ziggs Q that hits for 500-800 damage just hit an entire minion wave and just healed them for 300-600 hp for a single spell, and the active is basically another spell since it does high damage and slows. Say you have 600 ap which is fairly easy to reach, you just got a free spell that hits for roughly 500 damage and slows someone for free.

Not sure how you can say its a bad item, that item is pretty good even on champs that aren't Jax or Irelia, people just don't buy it for some reason. Its basically no different than Frozen Mallet, no one gets it but it is still an amazing item people just ignore for some reason.

Never said it's a bad item, I said it's bad for AP mages, who need other stats other than flat ap.

Since mana regen got all but removed on non-support items you have to stack mana now in hopes that Meditation will keep you topped off, you need CDR, and you need magic peen.

Don't get me wrong, Gunblade is an amazing item on assassins like Katarina and Leblanc, just not for the actual Mages.

I agree, I don't know if depressing is the word but season 6 has been absolute garbage so far. I don't know what Riot's doing but I've been on the brink of uninstalling the game for a while. The problem is like WoW back in the day there is no real alternative to what LoL offers, and like many I'm sure I enjoy the friend aspect above all else. That can only last so long though. Dynamic Q is literally the stupidest thing I've seen a dev do to a multiplayer game of this size, it has completely changed the experience and more often than not it's just frustrating. I'm going to refer to WoW again, the Cataclysm expansion was the turning point -- when competitive players stopped caring. I already see that trend now. League's hey day is all but over especially at this rate
I've been playing this game since S1 and my answer is: I don't know, I don't care, and its still fun :)
